item.title: Tighten up your cap table with Fidelity, Cimulate, and DepositLink at TechCrunch All Stage 2025
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: Fundraising is already hard — don’t let a messy cap table make it harder. At TechCrunch All Stage on July 15, founders will get a behind-the-scenes look at what it really takes to keep a raise on track during the roundtable session “Preparing to Raise: Cap Table Best Practices to Help You Close Fast.” Hosted […]

item.title: Writer CEO May Habib to take the AI Stage at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: AI agents are reshaping how work gets done across industries, and at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025, one of the leading voices in that transformation is stepping onto the AI Stage. May Habib, CEO and co-founder of Writer, will join us in San Francisco, October 27-29, for a fireside chat that dives deep into how enterprises are […]

item.title: Everything you need to know about Flashes, the Bluesky-based Instagram alternative
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: The app, which is now available in beta, offers a different way to browse the visual posts on Bluesky.

item.title: Israeli quantum startup Qedma just raised $26 million, with IBM joining in
item.dc:creator: Anna Heim
item.description: Qedma specializes in error mitigation software. Its main piece of software, QESEM, standing for Quantum Error Suppression and Error Mitigation, analyzes noise patterns to suppress some classes of errors while the algorithm is running and mitigate others in post-processing.

item.title: Google rolls out its new Veo 3 video generation model globally
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Google on Thursday said it has begun rolling out its Veo 3 video generation model to Gemini users in more than 159 countries.

item.title: AI job predictions become corporate America’s newest competitive sport
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: In late May, Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei appeared to kick open the door on a sensitive topic, warning that half of entry-level jobs could vanish within five years because of AI and push U.S. unemployment up to 20%. But Amodei is far from alone in sharing aloud that he foresees a workforce bloodbath. A new […]

item.title: French B2B neobank Qonto reaches 600,000 customers, files for banking license
item.dc:creator: Anna Heim
item.description: Qonto, which targets European freelancers and SMBs, currently operates with a payment institution license it obtained in 2018.

item.title: OpenAI condemns Robinhood’s ‘OpenAI tokens’
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description: OpenAI wants to make clear that Robinhood's sale of "OpenAI tokens" will not give everyday consumers equity — or stock — in OpenAI.

item.title: Wonder Dynamics co-founder Nikola Todorovic joins the AI Stage at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: TechCrunch Disrupt 2025 is back at Moscone West in San Francisco from October 27–29, bringing together 10,000+ startup and VC leaders to dig into what’s next in tech. And when it comes to artificial intelligence, the conversations aren’t just technical — they’re creative, cinematic, and boundary-pushing. That’s why Nikola Todorovic is headed to the AI […]

item.title: Lucid sales inch forward as EV maker pushes to ramp Gravity production
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description: Lucid sold 3,309 vehicles in the second quarter, a new record for the EV maker. Still, the company must ramp up production of its Gravity SUV to meet its 2025 target.

item.title: Substack brings new updates to livestreaming as it increases video push
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: The recent update enables creators to share clips of their live videos on Notes, and Substack will notify them in real time about the performance.

item.title: Could Google’s Veo 3 be the start of playable world models?
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: Demis Hassabis, CEO of Google DeepMind, hinted Tuesday evening that Veo 3, Google’s latest video generating model, could potentially be used for video games.

item.title: David H. Rosmarin brings a founder-focused approach to anxiety at TechCrunch All Stage
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: Startups demand constant decision-making and pressure-filled pivots, which bring big emotional swings. It’s no wonder anxiety shows up at every stage. But what if it didn’t have to be a liability? At TechCrunch All Stage 2025 on July 15 at Boston’s SoWa Power Station, Dr. David H. Rosmarin, clinical psychologist, author, and Harvard Medical School […]

item.title: Lovable on track to raise $150M at $2B valuation
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: Lovable released its vibe coder in late November. Within six months, the startup hit $50 million in ARR, CEO Anton Osika said.

item.title: Amazon is shutting down its Freevee app in August
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: Amazon plans to shut down its Freevee app, the company’s free ad-supported streaming service, in August, according to an in-app notice to users.

item.title: Tesla’s energy storage business gets sucked into the company’s downward spiral
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: For the second consecutive quarter, deployments of its Powerwall and Megapack stationary storage products have declined.

item.title: India’s Max Financial says hacker accessed customer data from its insurance unit
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: The insurance giant is one of the largest insurers in India.

item.title: Perplexity launches a $200 monthly subscription plan
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description: The plan, Perplexity Max, offers unlimited access to various services and priority access to its services using the latest LLM models.

item.title: TikTok lays off more employees working on TikTok Shop US
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: TikTok Shop US is conducting its third round of layoffs in as many months.

item.title: Terra CO2 cements $124M Series B to slash concrete’s carbon footprint
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: The startup said that it’ll be using the new funding to build a massive facility near Dallas capable of pumping out 240,000 tons of its supplementary cementitious material (SCM) annually.
